question_text: What is BIOS configuration reset and when would you perform this procedure?
answer_options: Updates BIOS firmware to the latest version from manufacturer
Restores all firmware settings to factory defaults, used for boot problems or corrupted settings
Creates a backup copy of current BIOS settings for restoration later
Optimizes BIOS settings automatically for better system performance
correct_answer: Restores all firmware settings to factory defaults, used for boot problems or corrupted settings
explanation: BIOS configuration reset restores all firmware settings to factory defaults, clearing custom configurations. Perform when: experiencing boot problems after BIOS changes, system instability from overclocking, password recovery needs, or corrupted settings. Methods include: load defaults in BIOS menu, CMOS jumper reset, or battery removal (older systems).
